verbera corripi merentes non est ira • sed ampla mititudo esse 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 decet poetam sed non 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 renendum est frendens rabula carnifex vocetur qui aurem vellit artifex habetur quo sque vrit leuis ira commerentes ho lenit niuea ar • scitè monentis ergo ludis honesté amor notabit naeuos leniter hostis aggrauabit g ad amicum meritò dilectum iohannem tailor aliàs aquinatem vulgó poëtam aquaticum hendecasyllabae qvod numen thamesis vagae per vndas plectro ludit eburno deorum physis dicitur eius hic sacerdos fundit millia mille ab ore cantus mulcens lepidum artibus popellum hunc quaerit dea hunc docet sua illi tam secreta libenter illa pandit quam tam rara decenter ille pendit hic verò rutilos tagi lapillos et grandes orientis vniones si mysteria tanta conferantur tricas quisquiliasque censet omnes de te sabula tota mi iohannes verso nomine scito praedicatur parnassus cerebrum tuum est bifurcus cor fons est helicon sedentque linguâ et musae charites venustiores ipse e tu tibi suggerens apollo extrà nil opus inuocare diues naturae tibi sat fauor ministrans intus pectore delitet feraci quod multis labor improbus dat aegré suffuratio et impudens librorum instinctus genij tui ingenique momento intimat euge perge lymphas plus vltra thamesis beate cygnos moeandri vada tortuosa curui non tot quot thamesis canora nutrit te vicisse iuuabit ho canendo no iuuabit omnia imprimendo hoc si feceris vnda dum manebit atque aestus thamesis manebis ipse et campanus vt est propheta aquinas anglicanus eris poeta aquinas g worthy welldeseruing friend welknown hydropoet iohn taylor till throat ake cry alowd hollo aucupate great fauors apollo one bacchus venus vrges blesse brainbrats caerulean surge gyrdling earth emball thy nerues season animall part quick organ man reason nimphadored sountaine farre excells aganipe aon bubulkes well daunst thy quinbrobo • te kisse thee often since roare misse thee wyned loue sicke thame bank orswel water visit ingenious darling cell blue neptune salt tempred thames sweet make thee tart pleasing theater late could cinthius halfe starud mist perswade applaud nay hisse made call neptune still let delos sinke swimme thee let phoebus looke winke vvhilst poore priest grow mad ill successe still write please lesse thine amphitritean muse growes arrident phoebus tripos stoopes neptune trident r h friend author sport hitherto haue told thy thy muse doth merit greater name soares high heaun earth water fly lea • ing baser matter mount sky hidden knowledge doth sweetly sing carelesse inferiour common thing oh soule could follow shun fowle sin seeke eternall blisse strength growes great may god euer send amend • aults doth mend robert branthwaite honest friend iohn taylor shall say kind friend let thee know worthily doe worke esteeme whereof thinke cannot much deeme find world wit doth flow poore vnpollisht praise bestow vpon well deseruing worke thine heere freely offer thy shrine like taper sunne doth showe bellowes helpe eols breath blow thou much hast soard beyond flraine whereto common mus doe attaine cintyhaes light exceeds wormes glow • muse reple learned phrase world know thy work deserueth praise thine best friendship richard leigh deseruing author iohn taylor disputed much among wise water skyes one waterman euer knowne row int oare none thy high surmounting pen soares aboue straine waterman whether seeke farre neere thart matchlesse sure eur hemispheere william branthwaite cant friend iohn taylor row good waterman looke back still thus thou dost vpon mus hill guide thee thy course thy boates sphaere thine vrania moue diuinely cleare well hast thou plid thy learned oare cut riner nobler shore euer landedat thy saile made clowdes swels prosprous gale say ferriman hell ferriman heaun know well thats thy selfe transporting soules blisse vrania sits helme pilot thames thou hast lactea via found thou bay star crownd thomas dekkar death haue stomacks like estriches want meanes eat vp sword pistol amongst haue long time noted great bountie haue beene fauorable giue men much ambition serued iustly breaking neck haue giuen abundance haue made abundance beget auarice auarice beget destruction haue furnished beautie beautie hath confounded chastitie haue suddenly thrown honor promotion haue loaden enuie slander continuall perplexity word gift mischieuously mixed wit beggerie follie wealth like protest wearie make thus bold tell iadish trick neuer fauored therefore haue reason flatter flatter man shall doe fauour neuer make tong like plaisterers trowell dawbe smooth ouer vice villanies sicophantizing parasiticall flatterie world craue thee liuing graue dead although flatter thee yet loue thee haue reason mee thy fawnings haue frownings thy beneuolence maleuolence courtesy care cross thy rich innumerable restlesle perturbation besides blessed sauior vpon earth thy estate vile damnable though praied tormentor crucifiers yet onely excluded world name praier saying pray world hope thou art better thou wert nay doubted thou art rather worse man say hath occasion loue thee hee either foole mad man indeed first father diffident towards god credulous toward thee first mother lyar first brother murtherer sweet kindred wee came yet thou obewitching world doest puffe v vp pomp making v forget originall esteeme clytus life world haue two request thee thou grant mee neuer thanke thee first good cloathes beare monstrous sway haue occasion speake great men without good cloathes like golden sheath leaden blade louing father reiect thy sharpe iudging ire thy multitude mercy rather recall thee recollect nigher wandring soule thy bosome gather thy grace gracelesse heart inspire dictate vnto mind may thinke write thy spirit may write ink 4 thou thing wast cun nothing thou thing didst nothing make nothing thou still hast brought passe againe nothing must betake sea shall burne l •• shall melt like brasse hill shall tremble mountaines quak • world chaos turne • againe thou almighty shalt remaine 5 since vniuersall massie ball earth aire water fire must ruine period fall againe nothing must retire thou whereby regall state thou turnedst slaue heaunly lustice doomd thee downe hell thy rebellion thy god thee draue gainst thee thing rebellion fell heaun thy due obedience ceast thy disobedience taught omnipotence 43 art thou polluted earthly clod thou span thou froth thou bubble thou smoke worse dust vnderfoot trod darst thou thy maker furie prouoke wilt thou wilfull thy perdition plod damnation thy saluation choke christ bought thy soule lent thee vse ti one thine therefore abuse 44 darst thou prophane thy vngodly breath name world elect thee darst thou dare iustice sword tvnsheath darst thou prouoke mercy reiect thee darst thou run headloug perpetuall death whereas eternall torment shall correct thee darst thou wretched worme earthly race belch blasphemy thy maker grace 45 thou offendest king king heaun earth hell doe tremble frowne bright angells archangells alwayes sings seat immortall crowne foe fell confusion downe sling giues seruants honour renowne power circumscribed euerywhere 46 nothing moue thy flinty heart ruthe thy selfe thou remorse wouldst take spend thy beauty strength youth serue souraigne stygian lake say morrow thou wilt seeke truth sin leaues thee thou wilt sinne forsake thou weaknes canst offend lame old rotten thou wilt god attend 47 hoary haire blood frozen chill eye waxe dim limb weake lame thy rash rebellious cannot performe vile deed sinne shame thou hast lost thy strength doe ill vnto heaun thy minde thou ginst frame thy youth satan seruice spent age thou thinkst god dost repent 48 supppose man thats much ingagd thee hath good horse thou dost much desire thou offrest thrice worth master beast thou dost require ingrate full wretch agree giue sell thee let thee hire let youth rid thy spightfull thy mortall foe 49 hees leane old lame blinde galld foundred filtby wanting disease botts glaunders spauin broken winde tooth left mumpe beanes pea companion vnkindly kinde let thee haue palfray thou please past good thou scornest receiue heele slay skin dog shall haue 50 betwixt thy god thee case thou art young strong sound winde lim thy soule body shuns heaunly grace thou wilt serue thy god waite heedlesse headlong runst hellish race till age hath brought thee graues hard brim clogd sin diseasd foule thou offrest god thy body thy soule 51 dost thou thinke thy command mercy must attend thy leasure dost thou thinke thou canst iudgement stand scape iustice high displeasure dost thou thinke almighty hand shortned supernall pleasure regard sonnes men doe liue without repentance heele forgiue 52 sly satan rage almost end command vassalllike craue lo thus crownes soueraigne ouerswayes rule raigne like slaue obeyes 67 thus angel c • usffe curse royalls make basenes farre base noble ignoble minde make worse mark mark figure disgrace crownes vsurpeth niggard purse heart contentment hath place angel royalls mark crownes put vertue mind clownes 68 onely slaue slaues moneyes slaue pine plenty starus amidst store dy liuing doth liue graue wealthywant abundance poore good hath badly doth depratte care may purchase himselfe cannot afford himselfe good meales meat wasting pelfe 69 feares wealth torment delight back 70 thinkes heare miserchurle obiect none railes wealth liue want idle grashopper cannot affect toylesome labour frugall ant ••• digall meanes checkt much purse lining scant fox doth scorne grape wot reach hang high 71 doth sort poore needy hyndes scum dreg euery common wealth shagragshaghand crue whose boundles mind must supplide shifting stealth like sick men paine reason blind enuy men well health doth swarme drone idle mate reuile enuie happy state 72 let storme ra •• e curse sweare within coffer keepe gold let themselues themselues piece teare haue got toyle care wele hold ist doth men reputation reare good wealth growes manifold care let needy rascalls raile till tyburne eat lothsome iayle 73 thus doth wretch thirst gaine excuse make bad trade good show thrift himselfe continuall himselfe doth muse vpon purchase gaining drift hog downeward lookes doe vse poare aloft eye lift take heauns fruit hoordeth vp nere remembers god whence came 74 fill thy baggs till ouerfilld empt thy conscience thou raise higher rent let thy land tilld tell thy selfe thou art happy man pull downe thy barnes boasting bigger build thy blessed state new began come voyce horror right thou foole ile granish man rich array therefore men rightly thinke humility would grow pride would shrinke fowles ayre dee yeeld fan plume poore ciuetcat allowes perfume earth ripd boweld rent torne gold siluer man queene city namd throughout world admird renownd fame thou hadst thing command england handmaide still rayment fewell fish fowle beast food fruit kingdome counted good neere farre remote agree bring best blessing vnto thee thus conceite thou seemdst rule fate whilst peace plenty flourishd thy gate could relieue thy misery well part thy woe sorrowes tell care easd thy reliefe study end thy griefe master freed feare tauerne went left whilst l vintner house remaind knowledge master state gaind let man say drunke selfe showe speake vnderstand know ile shew discommodities waite part euery vintner state first rowe house stand together one bignesse formd oddes either one vintner let amongst rest double rent ti set next french wine twenty pound tonne poore penny quart wonne besides sometimes caske doth finde lee sixe gallon lagge behinde celler laid carmen wineporters must paid misfortune caske weake foure gallon ground may leake taking vent may grow dead flat vintner little get fellow free heart must giue pint quart candle night day burning still within seller lest wine spill two kennellrakers chance come come ith euening must haue roome ouer one bare pint sit prate burne candle perhaps thereat whilst drawer must stay vp waite vpon fellowes ner late whilst candle kitchin waste another end ith seller haste one guest another barre thus one pint foure candle burning daylight haue seene doe call pipe pint candle time hath done ti quickly counted large summe vintner gaines amoūted besides charge euer great seruants wage cloathes fire meat linnen washing trencher losse plate glass broken course fate true mine owne knowledgebesides hath score looke make post look white black book debter seun long yeeres doe stay six penny quart wine heell pay merchant doe vintner trust forbearance deare answer must guest hane liquer braines swagger roaring straines goe sword eares fall one naild vnto wall man ands wife abusd seruants beaten moneyes payd drunke eaten house question brought man killd wiues heart sorrow filld whereas trade labour end night till midnight doth still attend besides drawer neuer good man yet euery pa • iry fellow call • oy fill wineat euery send honest sober guest thence vnto winemarchant went presently market sent butter egges exchangd country dame rangd husband gaue labring ditcher alehouse went bangd pitcher stay long exceeding loth venator venatri ••• •• ald hunt much meretrix •••• •••• hunted thinke verily hath beene time would one deere left many greatest forrests parkes chase christendome besides perfect mariner woodmanship hee hath ingrafted abundant gift promising one sweare vowe giue deere away sundry person vnder keeping command six seuen haue heard one white bucke small parke place could name within walles christendome hath beene giuen away least thousand seuerall person one keeper said keeper kind hee neuer deny bucke whosoeuer aske deere friend loue deere promise mee decre foure yeeres since foure deere iourneyes made deere still delayes demurres put decre promise time haue deere despaire deere meane take care deere adue deere indeed hee bounty promise deere hath grace blush whensoeuer see therefore doe loue modesty shamefastnesse beene doe loue indeed would long time haue sung kerryelison haue made beene glad haue promist brace buck haue stopd mouth withall although performance deere modesty affabilitie shewes shes descended gentilitie hundred troope barne doore courtesie theil stoope neate comely themselues pick one feather order stick grauely place place waggle like gossip freely gaggle sure thinke fashion prate wiues gossiping doe imitate ina good goose pli •• ie gesner doe finde goose strange sundry sort kinde scotland goose grow tree much humane reason disagrees bred ayre sunnes allquickning fire ner egge er dam sire thers soleand goose call female hath one allbookes neuer read sole much say alone • oland goose doe breed little iland scotland two mile within sea called basse betweene twenty fiue thirty meles beyond batwick aboundance lord owner iland doth yeerly receiue goose two hundred pound ster • ingand neuer soleand goose hatch • e else name may well proceede dam footsole whence breede claw hold vntill hatch gander fetch food goose doth watch winchester goose thers goose breed winchester et goose mind least three foure weekes rost keepes heat hotter tost shes seldome got hatchd honesty fornication adultery reaking lust foule incest beastly rape hath birth breeding shape besides whoremonger pander bawd pimpes whore harlets curtezans base impes luxurious letcherous goates hunt flockes catch glangore grinkums pockes thus got pleasure bred paine scarce ere come honest men remaine goose worst yet deare may heard pander cater feast bawde kitchin clerke see drest whore cooke pockey heate dresse dish fit deuill eate hot whorehunter goose doth serue whilst surgeon physician carue apothecary giues attendance still sauce lye onely bill hath turkey newmarket bin goose somewhat neere kin report fowles haue seene like thats payre sheeres betweene one set onely forth cost dressing worth goose way tolerated bat good men despisde hated one let alone eate owner bone moreouer nature contrary creature doth vary breeding thing could heare male doe still beger female beare hath euer dam masculine eagendred father feminine quite kim kam wiw waw differing sir female male mother cease muse soyle thy purer straine contagious mud rouze rouze againe polluted puddle take theame hand thou hadst taylor goose bvt yet little mirth doth make stay taylor goose come wadling way thing cannot giue epithite male female hermaphrodite vulcan brood whose dam sire windy bellowse smoake flaming fire nature much delight lye forge natiuity yet lying doth hurt commit stealing addicted vnto yet steele neere kin true doth opinion win ti mittlo hard backe sure ti dish ten men liues endure age hundred winter long tender twas twas young cooke get slender fee hath gibblets like goose neither breed feedes yet doth good doth helpe others get cloathes food goose shees tamest shees roame goose man may alwayes haue home ti dyet onely estrich tooth one yeere shipped away onely port leeth foure score thousand bole wheat oates barley spaine france fortaine part euery bole containes measure foure english bushel leeth onely hath beene transported neuerthelesse sell much bread • orne beyond sea yet haue sufficient themselues hauing viewed hauen towne leeth tooke passage boate see new •• rondrous well many one well come farre neere hope made flow trauell went galley foyst ancker quickly weighd sayle vp hoyst thirty mile past mile shore water twothese flat sand called spit foot deepe little thus past braue east saxon coast 3 morne till 2 noone almost shobury wakering fowl • nesse tutingham deeper water came crooked bay runnes winding farre maulden estersord colchester cause twas much ease men paine left land put mayne speed crooked way scape passe made strait frinton nasse 3 league land holding mainesheate hand espy coleblacke cloud rise forerunner tempest sky scarce sayld hundred time length winde began gather strength stiffe eolus neptune went cuffes huffes puffes angry counterbuffes boy sterous gust fell fearefull flawes whilst twixt wind water neer death jaw tost like corke vpon mounting maine vp whiffe straightway downe againe mindes much troubled said god blesse v weather word sea high grow ship forcd strike topsail low meane time winde scudded braue much like ducke top euery waue nothing violent permanent short space away tempest went farewell reader suppose welcome guest company much perplext let come send next leauing jesting thankes god giue twas mercy scape liue though thing mirth doe expresse yet many like ra •• haue filld whole volume ayrie imagination vnknowne vnmatchable worth • ireland amongst rest honor produce breed sparke valour wisedome magninimity nation world must giue place great toole toole muse take hand whose praise set forth full would make apollo mus barren nine worthy neuer compared betwixt haniball scipio great pompey tamberlaine oddes vnfit best • ell stirrop owne report ireland may reioyce england merry whose youth dedicated mar age westminster ancient cittie honourd beloued residence honour noble captaine toole thou famous man east west north southward • om boreas cold rump austers slauering mouthward • apolloes daughter witnes • uch would praise thee wit want fitnes • •• thou thy selfe thy selfe canst speake sowell •• ut though rime altogether goewell •• et world applause would attēd thee • ere al tongus mute thy tongue wold cōmend thee •• hy selfe vnto thy selfe art fame trump blasting • make thy name like buffe tough long lasting yet grāt thou braue man ner feard color ••• accept poore line artlesse sculler • hy bilboe oft bathd blood foe man •• ke cai • marius consull roman thou haft seemd dreadfull thy harnesse • hen babel generall great holopbernes • ore command nabuchadnezzar • nd renownd cayus iulius caesar • pon thy foe brest thou hast often troad free • soa pagan braue boloignes godfrey • ierce meibridates stout king po • tus • thou dost lead v dare confront v • hy matchlesse valour ten one tride euer libian strong alcides • nd men know neuer od piece fighting mettle sprung mar codpiece vpon maine land raging ocean thy courage hath attaind thee high promotion thou neuer feardft combate garganto thy fams beyond battaile lepanto mighty alexander macedo ner sought thou hast done thy tolede • e hold thee worthy base one one could haue fleece iason thou durst oppose gainst bore beare wolfe lion • nd torturing wheele fetch ixion acknowledge thy matchlesse vallour kill pasitbaes bull phalleris though age hath ouertaine thee yet thy grapple atax achilles hell monarch enuious ill facd pluto proue horne dambd cornu •• thou fearst diuell demogorgon yet valiant welchman shon morgan wizard fortune teller approue thee greatst monster quellers absolute potent dominator war counsell land water time tumult thou amongst irish hast made skip bog quaginires mirish whilst pursuit like angry dragon thou madst runne away rag thy foe bin thousand thy pistall thy good sword thou brauely wouldst resist thou wast v vnto rome titus stoutly sent foe blacke cocities kill cut throat thou art skild trick thou wert champion saint patri • ke know worthy compare thee liuing could outdare thee thee great tamberlaine tartar marcht thee britain arthur great haniball famous carthag • mate thee mine opinion seuerus vertues sumd vp totall remaine thee blind age would note thou shewdst thy selfe doughty wight dublin irish rebells madly brought trouble baltimore kinsale cor ••• yoghall thou thy power hast made oft cry fogh •• oft thy rage thou hast madly ran burning mouth combustious cannon thy fury thou hast beene hotter swifter ambler • rotter witnesse bound fierce •••• nnel rough bick • ring stour odennell slaues seud thee quagmites many war •• ke horse many nagmires thou kildst gammon visagd poore west • halians altototterd • torne tatterdemalians broaging roaging brawling base baz •• ians swiftfoot lightheeld runaway sla •• onians thou letst thē haue ground stand walke made flye doues doe falcon thou list fight lead band thy slaughtering sword thou layst thy hand thy fearefull foe would strait place abandon without hose shooes shirt band thou letst haue quiet place stand tongue pen cannot well verifide many hundred thousand thou hast terrifide thou hast racd castle fort garrison beyond arithmeticke past comparison prouerbe sayes comparison odious il therefore leaue incommodious thy action thou hast beene impartiall accommodating thy designes martiall mortall battels bruising battery thames often tribute brings subiects paying stock decrease yet payment thames doth still increase haue debtor swarme good might themselues harm inuectiue line word write say none pay whoso paye good ill freed compasse quill must take stupid asse vnfeeling let thing passe beare mindes wrong let know haue tongue pen wrong show ner briske neat trim bid pish tush theyre rotten tree beauteous rhinds fayre formed casket deformed mind like dispersed flock scattered sheepe pasture decorum keepe wildly skipping vnknowne ground stray forraine forbidden bound throgh want throgh excess •• scab worme murraine rot whilst wander guidelesse vncontrolde il doe best bring folde seeing sheepefold hurdle scant inforced supply want rayling therefore mine owne win like rotten forlorne sheepe il rayle admird immediately vnderstand besides want knowledge skill line may pasle well ill learned poet lately writ comparison comparing fit men writing inuentions like cheese stomacks well agrees loue cannot well disgest eare quite derest line sundry hand may come pleasing displeasing vnto one like well well commends second sweares ti naught madly rends third cry mew serues iawes awry scornfull humour layes thus like somwhat nothing one man liking anothers lothing want hope please men come want despaire hope shall please want ingratitude friend want willing mind whats written recant want gainst man peculiar spite want selfeloue vnto write want friend would want supply want foe would patience try thing want tell large volume booke would swell though selfe want doe boldly beare want great weight number sure burden thing want would breake backe elephant et curo care icare thinke vpon theame write care carefull yeelding delight though care flowes like continuall streame yet care barren theame fraternall loue thy coast thou presently remoue man thou lately lookst world sole woder else hel rouze thee distracting thunder therefore iones friendship thou dost tender safe arriuall see thou dost like ideot foole adore— thy workes wisedome glory placeeuer before— wonder vpon wonder more— pen instead lance gore— thy odcomb foppery bore— thy pride altitude fore— thou art theame write my— story ought befell be— story hardhearted fate gainst thee rore— vpon bookes name called crudity tom coriat haue seene thy crudity methinkes strangely brude piece patch together glude— like thee illfauourd hude— many line see lewd— therefore fit subdewd— within thy broyling brainepan stude— twixt thy grinding iawes well chewd within thy stomacke closely mude— last court country spude— wisedomes eye viewd agree rude— foolery full endude— wondrously fooles pursude— sweet gall amaritude— seeming full pulchritude— write intrude— therefore wisedome conclude— simile learning lushious grape bacchus heating vine ripe maturity sprung prest conuerred wine closd caske tight head bung chance chanceth take vent spils wine colour strength sent eun thy latine thy greeke good till thy musty hoggeshead author doth equiuocate writing word ••• word prittily seemes curtall imagine done sportall perswades thee trauell agen make world surfet thy pen glareanus vadeanus thou fatall impe glastenburie abby prophecie includes thou art baby ouer odcombs towne must one day ferrie whiting earst ouer glastenberie yet ti pitty one thy rare skill like monke drowned vpon hill thou canst climbe heauen hempen string thy euer muse shall sing yet ti safer trunke hide dangrous wincing iade ride iohannes iackeson thou hast traueld much coast coast come eat egge rawe rost like friend man hath plaid cooke potchd ginnie egge thy booke michael draiton here another followes messe haste thy booke come presse shortnesse time fault he come brings thee spoon salt say thou hast taught right behauior great men may liue fauor bid thee liue loues ioyne whose worth vertues like thine nicholas smith author liuely hath thy fame exprest yet line different rest doe thy praise pen say thou art farre vnlike men man thy honour doth relate many courtier thee doe imitate feare thou shouldst stolne away make themselues like thee may lose thee false theft slaughter court feare weep want laughter thy greatnes poreblind world may see say thy peeres haue iudged thee stand censure make deniall surely thou hast noble triall laurentius emley here one commends thy booke body paine counsel thee trauell againe whereas treasure thy wit body shall tire lumpish asse dronish noddie horse beares thy corpes ease shall find men haue bearing thy minde thy minde many paire gallowes waighs thee twentie thy fellowes nothing thy iourney small mickle thy minde thou barrelldst pickle men see thy minde able there confusion ere babel there confusion tongue tower loftie steeple lowly bower libbets rack round menting wheeles haddockes paddockes slipprie eeles wit sense reason death life loue hate concord strife seuen deadly sinnes liberall art doe thy minde discord haue tane part doubt side conquest winnes either liberall art deadly sinnes fourtie elephant beare loade pondrous thing haue thee abode thy minde waighs write speak heauie burden atlas backe would breake iohannes dauis gentleman thy trauels doth relate applauding much hardnesse thy pate thinke thy head hard steele rockes could thy coxcomb else endure knock brauest smithes britaine haue tane paine beat vpon anuill thy braines let beat thou canst abide blowes thou countst thē fauors thy friend bestows one cockscombe hit thee comb another ass eares strike home another fooles coat cap hard driue giues thee clap let strike please strike thy hardened head stroke dislike blow boore giue thee vineyard thou putst vp neuer drewst thy whiniard thou tookst beating boorish foeman hope thou wilt scorne knocke man richardus badley here one whose line cōmend thee say foole pentecost whitsontide meanes ouerthrow thee thy owne blunt weapon ouercrow thee true thinkes ti wondrous strange thou many country shouldst range hast tongue latine greeke yet gainst foole shouldst haue thy wit seeke session house like haue seene malefactor bar haue beene wellread schollers booke would plead yet liues haue power read thou great polypragmon wast graueld wise foole thē elsewher thou traueld henricus peacham rare sight city court towne author say thou brauely putst downe horrid darke eclipse sunne moone lyon elephant baboone huge whalebone thats hangd alexandra interrupted way carried city called ligerne duke florence dominion two yeeres hee learned good italian indian borne brought vp mahometan religion pronounced speech hundred people whereof none vnderstood himselfe hee afterward told meaning part farre could remember others also spoken thus much turky persia mahomet would haue rosted vpon spit mogols dominion christian may speake much freely hee mahometan country world speech afterward translated english bvt pray thee tell thou mahometan dost thou sadnes call mee giaur doe quoth quoth sober sadnes retort shamefull word thy throate tell thee plainly musulman thou art giaur arab word musulman thou dost vnderstand cannot properly applied mahometan onely christian doe consequently inferre two kindes muselmen one • n orthomusulman true musulman christian pseudomusulman false musulman mahometan thy mahomet thou dost deriue thy religion assure thy selfe know better one mahometans amongst many million yea particular circumstance life death nation parentage driuing camel egypt syria palestina marriage mistris whose death hee raised himselfe base contemptible estate great honour rich manner coozening sottish people arabia wouldest spit face thy alcaron trample vnder thy foot bury vnder la • e booke strange weake matter selfe meanly thou dost see mee attired haue already written two better bookes god thanked god gracious permssion write another better truer yea would haue thee know thou mahometan renouned kingdome england borne learning doth flourish many thousand boyes sixteene yeeres age able make learned booke thea • thy alcason neither thou rest mahometans doe generally beleeue composed wholy mahomet hee dull wit hee able make without helpe another namely certaine renegado monke constantinople called sergis alcoran like arrow drawne quiuer another man perceiue thou dost wonder see mee much inflamed anger would haue thee consider without great cause moued greater indignity offered christian arthomusulman bee called gtaur giaur christ whose religion professe incomparable dignity thy mahomet worthy bee named yeere wherein blessed christ neither alcoran worthy bee named yeere wherein doe preuailed god time drought haue obtained conuenient aboundance raine time pestilence suddai • e cessation plague effect holy seruent prayer neuer thewords mahometans doe often repeat prayer walke two pace hee shall stumble dung hill defile himselfe paradise one amongst thousand knoweth therfore tell thee standeth country situate betwixt heauen earth called vtopia whereof mention third booke thy alcaron seuen thirty asaria expressed mysticall obscure termes difficult vnderstand vtopian paradise say reward superstitious mumbling prayer often ducking downe head kisse ground deuout reputed giaurs giaurs one thing tell thee thou mahometan conclude redious speech whereunto thy discourtious calling giaur hath inforced mee prethee obserue conclusion learning precious iewell man hath life hee attaineth knowledge diuine humane thing commeth man either reuelation otherwise call inspiration industry learning reuelation call god doth infuse aboue speciall grace vnto vse instrument glory without labour trauell doe aspire eminent degree knowledge learning industry call man doth purchase himselfe continuall writing reading practice meditation neither meanes haue mahometans acquired meane much lesse singular learning mahomet himselfe man superficiall meane learning neuer one disciple part world indued profound knowledge wee christian one meane haue attained exquisite science incident mani meane blessed apostle sauioursome men neuer brought vp study hauing beene expert generall learning onely god speciall illumination haue spent forty yeeres practice thereof others continuall practice writing reading haue beene excellent became lampes star country wherein liued thing cannot possibly come passe omnipotent god deale partially mankinde reueale people altogether misled ignorance blindnes mahometans conceale v christian bestowe life time practice diuine humane discipline ardent inuocation god holy name sincerity purity heart goe thou pseudomusulman thou falsebeleeuer since thy iniurious imputation laid vpon mee thou calledst mee giaur thou hast prouoked mee speake thus pray thee let mine answer bee warning thee scandalize mee like manner christian bread phara • h fat kine leane deuoure great thieues swallow small one powr sure thinke common burglary pickpocket highwaythieues pilferies thus felloniously doe thieue thieues whose laboursthe trade thieuing profitable menmany doe relieue poore thieues doe iaylors want supply doe vnderkeepers still rely thieuing money still gotten thus many warrant mittimus men apt filch thieue twere worse many high vnder shrieue haltermaker smith getters fatall twist pondrous bolt setter carman hath share amongst rest although voluntary yet hees prest balladmaker doth profit reape make taburne dirge exceeding cheape whilst printer dolefull singer doe gainfull businesse dip finger hangman hath sleight skill extract good others ill epilogue vnto law iawes death life doth draw last hangman broaker reapes fruit selling one thiefe anothers suit besides thieues fit member ti knowne make men caréfull keepe owne still lye rockd cradle security lulld base idlenesse sluggish sloth apt ill goodnesse loth would infect v corrupt blood therefore health sake theeues good men prone steale thinke natrall meate drinke borne tot cannot doe withall must filching still er befall wispe rush clod land wadde hay thats next hand theyl steale haue good excuse doet keepe hand vre vse texcuse thiefe case say crime void grace men scarce haue feeling thought er like thieues gallowes brought obey false god commit offence th eternall god omnipotence doe grauen image adore worse thieues yet hangd therefore ti treason high take god name vaine yet men dot frailty gaine sabbath prophand continually whilest hast thou little slender taste designes disgracd beholding sir come beene stir cause people longd thy selfe see lookd thou shouldst disgraced bee see v two people repaire see heare play player still enraged muse angry quill leaue thy carkas apparell vnto hangman shall end quarrell full opinion thee sure churchbooke thy name recorded thou wast begotten ditch betwixt tinker maundring witch sure thy birth equall thy begetting thinke thy mother sunshine fitting basking selfe close hedge thorne without midwife thou wast borne sunne illustrous light screwd quite awry windowes thy sight afterwards matron • thought meet wrap thee vp within hedgestolne sheet making thee sweet vnchristian packe six seun yeere bare thee backe instructing thee braue canting tong pedlers french sing song vnrespected graund collection iustly collected doe hope blisse hate thee good credit thou hast got court citty thy praise ill sing way thou didst delight king many tedious care daily throwne vpon royallhead weares crowne action would melt spright thereby giue souraigne delight thing doe loue wish thee well thinke thee doe dwell therefore hate thee thou dost behaue thy selfe like coozning dea • st coriat whose bosome thou didst bolt story looke batterie wall gainst knight oth sun archibals expect captaine ottooles vnderstanding bulwarke thou art banding better temper nobler spirit euer thy base bosome could inherit gainst cynthia like wolfe thoult bark howle whereby thou shewst thy iudgement dark foule thou grieust muse reflecting rayes hath quite eclipst famous sculler praise thou wouldst haue poesie none flourish thy selfe thou art curtish banish selfeconceit false shadie dreames hang thy heart driue thee extreme doe presume counsell thee hatst good counsell thou hatest wherefore leaue thy brazen impudence answer thy reuenge defence defence rascalllike thou dealst first thou shewst antiquitie thart nurst darst thou thy satyremusicke boast standst bound vnto whipping post spare thee thou intemperate asse vntill bride well thou shalt currant passe thou sayst better deuill deale thou dost thy wickednesse reueale haue nought doe thee thou companion god blesse crouch whyne thou giust occassion must laugh thy absurd perswasion thou art lernean snake squeeze thine owne gall ti bad make thee inke withall thast gone long styx mingled inke thy verse men nosthrils stinke pen scritchowles feather tough goose wing thee good ynough thou hast emblazd basest slaue men name freely send thee backe agen vntill world hath better eye see basest lacke selfe thee thou callst rogue artificiall must iudge thee one naturall iniurie proceeded thy tongue yet thou wouldst make thy cloake wrong dost thou thinke matter hand selfe thy counsell abhore take thou heed inchanted spell iohn tayler ended like achitophel foolish asse like thee would take hand play play couldst vnderstand thine owne folly thou art blind onely basenesse thou art well inclind dost thinke businesse wait thy detested popperies conceit yet protest hadst thou sent bill answer id haue shewd skill would haue beene much thy disgrace thou againe durst ner haue shewd thy face canst thou imagine went away feare thee thy contemned play know foole stage purchasd worth scornd send thee helpe forth put case challenge thee thy rayling spirit could answer mee thou art nothing without three month fludie id beat braines muddie fiue shilling confesse thee protest seruant mee repay thee since fayle thou mightst haue sent write ray • hold honestie deere thames reuenewes yeere thou driust short demurre know thou shouldst call cristian curre oh haue found griefe see curres christian alike thee thy credit treason slaine faith know none thou hadst loe staine wonder much thy simplicitie thou shouldst challenge sharking thee troth rather giue thee gift see thee driuen paltrie shift thou thy squire oft haue ferried mee oft mine haue timd thee euer haue sung nastie whore thou pander like thee kept dores sure little meanes two penny thou wilt carry knaues queanes know thou meanst doxie dell seemes thou art acquainted well scrappes broken beere rate rime thou shalt haue share though much wealth want maintaine ill neuer trouble whore rogue thee allow squinteyde yet eye thy baboones trickes anatomize prethee deuils crambd word iudgement thee thou art dambd id rather wish thee talke thy saluation left hate hurtie thee damnation hadst thou begun brothell transcended vnto tauerne thou state hadst mended thou dost thou canst cut throat cheat tinker groat thou hast many voyage hell nemesis like thy visage well make hel number one fuller charon take thee vnder sculler frō tossing torment torment thee ill find shelter though discontent thee dost thou blame tongue hungry chapps foddered thou wouldst title embrodered syrra though meddle mate thou shouldst learn manner forbeare state descant vpon court king twere fitter thou shouldst sculler sing presumptuous quartercockatrice see light troth worthy man sight sorry thy credit tainted make thee thy chaundler vnacquainted vvill score egges cheose saw thy hope vpon knee rather thou shouldst lay fault come dwell il passe word thee reputation thou canst haue baker debt alewife score thou denid bread drinke thy writing thy rowing like shrinke leaue inuectiues trust vnto thy scull thats way fill thy belly full meat drinke besides consolation thou laborst truly thine owne vocation shouldst thou stagger poesie attended pouerty wish thee friend ner goe guesse thart poore ynough without see thou art bare desperate thou wouldst turne hangmanto aduance thy state hang vp sculler il ormatch stand see hempen halter catch old prouerbe neuer failed yet spread net friend snare owne foot yet wonder since thou hatst life thou shouldst professe kindnesse wife thy hot loue without deceit seruent kitchin maide shall take thee seruant loue wife proceeds scorning thy person thy deed thou calst wittol lead quiet liues none rascal abuse wiues disaster day thou miscarridst thy hopefull play thy mishap long discourse ill tell thou amongst madst beastly smell thou dost commend player action ashamd thy distraction much thine praise allow none amongst plaid foole thou thou wouldst faine find fault yet knowst thy bosome appeareth cleare thy chiefest rayling thy strongst euasion yet thou art occasion another thou blamst audience thou wast cause impatience better sort said wise enuffe keepe blacke whirlewind puffe almost blew hanging stage er folly knowne age thou sayst maundering begger credit got thou knowst know poet wrot rest deuisde thee nothing heape fopperie heard thou letst wine run tumbling downe thy rotten windpipe like drunken clowne yet thy lion drunke could defend thee twas thy ape drunke made men cōmend thee day censure thou canst escape sayes thy action plaid ape thy tobacco stinking stuffe people cryd enough enough thy third act shewd humor men frantick wherin like asse thou stoodst anticke saw whether good bad wise men iudge thee either foole mad thy last act shewes thy skill vpon sea rare displease conclusion tempest rose blew thee made thy friend thy foe wouldst thou load back filthy tearmes there nothing else thee penne affirmes hadst thou done well credit beene thine ill thoudst haue shame mine money pleasd thy humor passing well thy discredit made thy anger swell aboue verge patience thy sayle blowne full enuy burst selfe rayle publikely priuate hole kindle thy malice diuels coale water true honestly quench raging heat villany brauely thou canst brag swagger talk thou shewst thy plenteous beggery wir makst thy annagram much vnfit thy name thirteene letter weene thy annagram thou hast fifteene william fennors annagrams feare man se much guesse first thy ancestor keepe within fenny ground hoge kine sheep liuing hogheards poore labring men tooke name fennor fen write iest muse doth smile thinke thou wast begotten stile thy father looking one way thy mother feare spide lookd another leering sundry way kept carefull watch lest businesse catch thats reason thine eies doe rowle squint thy doltish iobbernowle cry thee mercy booke thy coat armes much mistooke fen first thou didst suruiue thy scutchion fen deriue marke emblaze thee ilbe briefe within quagmirefield two toades chiefe • lope staffe bend hold best paire oxe horne rampant crest well mantled old raw tough cowhide thus armes diuide subdiuide calling taylor shred dish worthy whereon fed could cut sow steale stitch well thou canst lye would rich time hath bin pooriohns scrap would fill hungr • maw thredbare lowzy thou hast forgot thou rimst late sixteene oyster billingsgate thou hast forgot gaue thee old breech thou sungst spokst extrumpry speech barly bread lamp oyle thou didst eate pooriohn thee bin good meat vpon false annagram name art ashamd false print thy muse like thine eye sure squint world may see name • affords thou hast thrust two make vp word hate rayle foe william fenner thou hast lookt ouer perceiue seene thinuectiue scourge reuenging spleene wisely thou demst thou weighest lightly thou gracelesse disgrace thou esteemest slightly there bad word writ well thou knowst thou hast deserued thought owd thee would rayle till paid score though iust incensed anger sleepe yet doe keepe satyres whip weepe salt brine quicke shall scourge thee dare angry muse vrge leaue sir il little • irke yee milder lash il gently ierke yee rayle rogue thee • slaue thee finely baffle beard braue thee il squeeze crush vnto poulder pounce thee il make thy wit euer renounce thee il lay thee open attaint thee pittifull poore scab il paint thee il nip strip whip thee breath like bubenax il rime thee vnto death thou sayst verse impotent hault thou dost accuse thy onely fault alack rime thou canst doe naught cobble thy cripled verse vp downe doe hobble doe lamely runne rise fall like maimed beggers hospitall thou hast iudging vnderstanding eare thy accent thy sillables reare let fall thou botchest many line would shame father mine tressillable verse doth end ti harsh ti palty doth offend translation would beare inuention offends eare thou often endst thy line memory thou answerst pillory thou comst vpon horribly conclusion writst solowsily thou gettsta poet dignity il hang thee mine owne benignity thers many fault thou makst wold show feare twould make thee halfe poet well know thou wouldst vnthankfull wouldst deny thou learndst thy skill • il therefore leaue thee plague time selfeconceited witlesse asse rime know thy ouerdaring minde doth dare inuention compare indeed fortune thing haue done many sayes better wit run let enuious misconceit belye thee dare try purpose darst thou thus much doe let one man giue one theame betwixt v two theame thy rime fret tender ski • ti rougher russian beare rub fret gaules gentle eare thou art rarest fellow aboue ground serue costiue lord hard bound thy riming would procure easie stoole seruice hath sauour goodman foole doctor apothecary swears lugge thee ass care thy riming doth purge men art many yeeres thou namst rabblement fooles tom coriat archy great otooles asse thy selfe foole ner take thee dame nature first thinke make • one compound two simple foole knaue striuing thee maistry haue crafty knauish part got sway turnd silly harmelesse foole away thy making nature care chiefe fashion thee purpose thiefe •• ee turnd thine eye keele vpwards nonce thou mightst see fiue six way thou hast admirable looke • forme thiefe windowes hooke apparell cushion carpet rugge sheete withall hooke crooke meete doe say thou dost trading vse •• therein thou making dost abuse thou closely followst trade thee thy thiefelike eye made great man house men flocke thee ti heare thee time cause doubt thee therefore euery one keep carefull watch feare thou shouldst plate sōwhat catch thou thinkst applaud thou hast rimd fearefull thy fist limd butler sweat feare whilst thou dost prate double diligently guard plate thy beautious phisnomy doth woman feare thee thou art witch therefore snatch child vp run toy ominous illlooking looke shun iudge thou euer speake thy countenance thy neck globe rotunditie world like ruffe spaine doth encircle aspiring braine vnbounded pride doth still persist haue set poaked list set organpipes compare becausethey doe offend paritan whose zeale doth call superstition badge beast babilon ruffes onely first request abilitie best plaine stichd lacd shagge àre price worne tagge ragge spaine world would weare shall see like ruffes world shall seatred ••• muse hath worne clowts turnd ash • nd thers end ont must pursue old consumed purchase new • ow louely laundresse whose cleane trade •• th onely cause linnens cleanely made •• ing two extreme relying ••• euer wetting shees euer drying ••• men dye liue liue dye ••• doth shee dry wash wash drye ••• runnes like luna circled spheare ••• perpetuall motion shee doth steare ••• course compasse round endlesse still like horse labour mill • shew plaine shee worke doth frame ••• lianens foule er shee doth wash ••• washing course march ••• wring fold pleits smoothes starch ••• stiffens poakes set dryes againe • nd foldes thus end paine begin paine •• like whirligigge lenten top •• plenteous spring still doth drop ••• soddes vnto sea may compare reake smocke wind fish linnen • laundresse fish foaming froth doth lighten • whilest tongue doth thunder affrighten totall tempest full chiding man house hath quiet ding ••• l • ndresses resty full wroth • hen lathering bumble broth ••• blame though brawle talke • en haue nought doe may goe walke ••• commonly worke profit brings goodwife washeth husband wring ••• though verse thus merrily doth stray ••• give laundresse still due pray thy dull lazy muse idlenesse lethe hatefull lake therefore stand vpon vaine excuse rise thy tooles thy selfe betake remember although carkasse rot write call foole iester yet pray thee taylor ranke among knaues doe world bepester thou wrotst great toole coriat braue sir thomas parson knight oth sun archy hath thy verse glory yet thou nought ha • euer done write ireland mar trayne long time vnder noble norris serue could stoodgainst pope spaine whilst slain wth want starue shot wound knock gave tooke vntill last halfe maimed man decrepit warres forsooke passe country passe getting health shooke hand death court often made resort england mighty queene elizabeth allowd entertainment disport foretop take old time halfe many fooles haruest onely prime purse receiuing wit plow compasse iests would hold though gaue man gird twaine reuenge would giue gold commendation nimble • raine thus liud till gracious queene deceast succeeded famous king whose blest son reigne yeeres opprest graue sicknesse death bring kind iacke thou seest ayrie forme hath shaken iayle flesh bone whilest remaine feast many worme better part doth visit thee alone betweene v still good request thou neuer neuer thee denyd sake collect merry iests whereby sad time may mirth supplyd ti written find good man forth one thou thinkst liud friend though thy line may little worth yet vnto duty recommend farewell iacke dame luna gin rise twinkling star begin borrow light remember suit thee aduise good honest iacke good night swifter shaft bow cut curried empty ayre whilest amazd feare could snow straight felt spirit quickly repayre though found dreame indeed yet sake dreamed left bed cloathd selfe speed presently betooke pen cleere morne phoebus lent light followeth began write vvit mirth 1 selfe caried old fellow water wealth enough deputy ward wit sufficient scauenger water somewhat rough hoe much afraid stead saying prayer threatned drowne hee would spend hundred pound hee would see hanged desired quiet feare nothing little space landed beanes colledge bankside •••• paris garden well said glad water boat miscariad could haue swum goose 2 old painter repairing church writing sentence scripture vpon wals chance friend mine came church reading perceiued much false english old man said friend doe write true english ala si •• quoth painter poore sample people parish wil goe cost 3 two men sate table one one hauing cup hand dranke saying op ••• drinke opposite said angry would haue thee put thy nickname vpon thou shalt well know opposite thy selfe skin betweene thy browes 4 wealthy monsieur france hauing profound reuenues shallow braine told man continually gape sleepe angry man saying hee would beleeue man varified true master said hee would neuer beleeue told except quoth hee chance see •••• mine owne eye therefore ••• great lookingglasse hanged •••• • eet purpose try whether thou art lying knaue 5 said monsieur commanded man buy great hat button • rim button vp behind man bought one brought put head button looked •• glasse saw angry say ••• ••• crossed vntoward knaue bid thee buy hat button hold vp behind thou hast brought one turnes vp command thee goe thy wayes buy mee one would haue whatsoeuer cost 6 gallant trauelled would haue goose supper rosted brought table hee said stunke hope said hoste cannot sute aliue since came house may quoth monsieur sure kild shiting shee would neuer stunke else 7 exceeding tall gentlewoman riding behinde short little man man head reached higher breast aforesaid monsieur perceiuing said madam ride great deale better put legge ouer pummell ••• another time chanced meet lady acquaintance asked shee good husband fared word wept saying husband heauen heauen quoth first time heard sorry heart 8 said monsieur saw fellow iackdaw sell sirra quoth wilt thou take thy daw monsieur said fellow price daw two french crownes wherefore said dost thou aske much fellow replied daw could speake french italian spanish dutch latine tongue hee speake little acquainted lordship house well quoth bring thy daw thy money conclusion iackdaw moneth fiue weekes time neuer spake otherwise father speech kaw kaw whereat monsieur said knaue cozened money great matter losse quoth though daw doe speak yet good hope thinkes 9 another time hee commanded man buy sweet thing burn chamber quoth chamber stinkes odoriferously man brought frankincense paper hee going fire master • sted finding sticke teeth rellish bitter hee called man cozening knaue would bring bitter trash money straightwayes commanded buy pound best sugar burne straight sweeten persume chamber 10 gallant youth much addicted dicing many time lost money hee would pawne cloake goe home without either cloak coyne grieued lady mother much remedy whereof shee caused doublet stuffe soeuer made canuasse painted backes whereon fashioned two fooles caused gentleman euer keepe cloake backe feare two three discouered 11 vvill backstead plaier cast chamberlye window night chanced light vpon head watch passing angerly said offer v abuse quoth said one pickled watchman watch watch quoth william friend know harme watch harme catch 12 cardinall rome goodly faire house new built broken brickes tile sand lime stone rubbish commonly remnant building lay confusedly heapes scattered cardinall demanded suruayor wherefore rubbish conueyed away s̄uruayor said purposed hyre hundred cart purpose cardinall replyed charge cart might saued pit might bee digged ground bury lord said suruayor pray shall wee doe earth digge said pit horseson coxcombe said cardinall canst thou dig pit deepe enough bury together 13 poore country may praying deuoutly superstitious old image loy image suddenly fell downe vpon poore man bruised bone sorely hee could stirre abroad moneth space cheating priest set vp new image country man came church againe kneeled farre new image saying although thou smilest lookest faire vpon mee yet thy father plaid knauish pranke lately ile beware come neere thee lest thou shouldest haue thy father unhappy quality 14 lady hauing beene ten yeeres suite law triall last iudgement went side whereupon would presently expresse ioy plying bowle shall perceiue many variety ••• inn wringing necke lifting vp shoulder clapping hand lying dowae one side running bowle making long dutifull scrape leg sometimes bareheaded entreating flee flee ••• pox ont ti short though bowler bee gentleman yet hee may meet attendant rookes somtimes bee better six foure two one doe know thing fitter bee compared bowling wooing ••• doe see one another two dayes say good lord seuen yeeres since saw louers doe thinke absence time sleepeth presence hee wild gallop bowler although allye marke bee thirty forty pace yet sometimes haue heard bowler cry rub rub rub sweare lye hee gone hundred mile bowle hath beene short blocke two yard hee short thousand foot hee vpon head iacke ten twelue foot beyond word many seuerall posture bowles ridiculous idle tale iests booke yet bowler weake stomackt euer casting sometimes giue stab alley head god thanked bloud shed sometimes bestow pippin one vpon good apple il assure marke ayme hath sundry name epithites blocke iacke mistris blocke birth breeding shewing mettle house came iacke smoothd gotten handsome shape forgets house hee came suffering better giue often salute whilest hee like iack sauce neither knowes himselfe know superior hold mistresse fittest name commonly termed mistress much better mine aunt mistris oftentimes marke euery knaue haue fling euery one striues come neere hee would kisse yet short wide ouer doth kisse may perhaps sweeten lip assure shall neuer fill belly rather empty purse much bowling feare mee haue bowled beyond marke 98 minister riding west part england happened stay village sunday hee offered kindly bestow sermon vpon constable hearing ask minister licēced preach yes quoth hee hee drew box licence latine truly said constable vnderstand latine yet pray let mee see perhaps shall picke heere word good sir quoth minister haue word pickt spoyling licence 99 clinch country man demanded riuer called ranne country hee answered neuer need bag baggage troyes fruitfull queene many child beare braue heroicke stout crue noble action accrue age made parent bald bare made daintlesse courage appeare amidst throng danger debate war eclipsd little teirce wine onely falne hood winkd nap men may vpon bench hap iustice seemes dease tale told perhaps charity hath tane cold may cause rattling coaching neighing horse gate approaching thence stable owne certaine truth thereof yet knowne sure dease heare nothing clarke blowes care clark good men must oroach stand bare else small iustice mongst shall share master like weathercocke inclinde doth please make turne winde iustice sences bereft except feeling onely feeling left swallowes infariate power bribe doth cormorant fish deuoure cutpurse argvment mad knaue liues trickes sleight diues la • dy within ayre serues noman yet courteously waite lift church towne throng faire worke yet well cleathd fed farewell seldoms dy in bed spirit ferrit next enters although merchant much venture though noted coward yet valiantly doth liuing get hath weapon curtoll knife wherewith hath hazard life east indian merchant crosse raging flood ventering venter good themselues hope securely sleepe neuer plow dangerous ocean deepe doe lose pirate tempest tocks ti fleabite wealthy stockes whilst poore cutpurse day night doth • oile watch wardes doth himselfe turmoile • oft cut purse session barre whilst others liues pleading sturbridge faire vnto bristoll amble ieopardie liuing ramble get doth beg borrow venture necke there end hang sorrow whilst midst peril doth drinke sing hath pursebearers king liues like gentleman sleight hand play foist nip stale stand snap curb crosbue warpe lif • decor prig cheat hanging shift still valiant come free care dare stockes whip moraine take purse agen another sattin cutpurse dawbd lace country gentleman fors purse chase blewcoat seruing man wait passing narrow obscure strait thieuing knaue purse nimbly nim like alandsharke thence land swim seruing man perceiud cutpurse tricke said nought dogges thin thick vntill thiese supposd coast cleare pissing blew coat offs care cutpurse madly gin sweare curse said giue master purse stole lately pocket there wrong done here eare • gen thus though cutpurse trade counted ill •• • n action still wai • e ambassador come go attends tiltings tryumphant showes westminster still 2 rome approach thy confusion thy antichristiā kingdome must tumble ni • srods proud cloudpiercing babylon like hellhatchd pride despight thy hart must humble scorne damnd equiuocation line like thunder thy region rumble downe dust must lye thy painted glory row write thy tragicke story epigram 3 whē god thing nothing framd man named thing •• namd god shewed man way behaue ill would dam good would saue creature world containe made subiects man lordly raigne faire paradise princely adam walke god himselfe often talke angel enuious proud striud ascend aboue highest cloud mighty god make zant first day ianuary 1616 winde north east prosperous gale 8 day morning sight island sardaine wind come westerly 9 morning stood callery noone wind southerly came close tower two league wee made fight day night wind growing calme wee sailed towards cape 10 day wee little wind none till two clocke afternoone draue v three league eastward cape pola •• pied fleet ship vpon maine sardaine neere vnto road called callarie belonging king spaine 12 day ianuarie day morning watch 4 clocke wee sight sayle making shore towards v draue mind doubt feare comming neere vnto v wee espicd bee sattie ship much like vnto argosey great burthen bignesse perceiuing imagined ship bee farre whereupon master sent one companie vp maine tip discouered fiue sayle ship one another comming vp wind west southwest prospectiue glaffe perceiued turkes men warre first booning himselfe wind flag mainetop sayles gallantly spread abroad came admirall viceadmirall two reareadmirall fellow fiue number well prepared desperate assault wherevpon immediately made ready ordinance small shot little resolution prepared selues withstand done went prayer dinner master gaue v noble incouragement heart euer thirsted proue successe readinesse fight master went vpon poope waued sword three time shaking dauntlesse courage already wonne victorie done wee seconded like forwardnesse whereupon hee caused trumpet sound gaue vnto v much encouragement within shot master commanded gunner make leuell shoot missed formost bore vp apace wind v returned v good wee sent betwixt v great space fierce encounter hauing aduantage v reason wind 11 12 clocke layd v aboard one theyr ship 300 tunne thereabouts 35 piece ordnance 250 men captaine thereof one walsingham seemed name bee english man admirall fleet signified flag maine house kept larbord side clee • e whilst men ordnance musquets playd vpon ship yet plyed gallery small shot sort wee stood great danger yeeld last shot quite thorow thorow v likewise affraid haue beene sunke v bore head ship hee passed along wee gaue broad side forced lay ley mend leakes fight continued two houres glasse better neere shore dweller thereupon saw beginning ending danger stood vpon 31 ianuary morning english dutch fleet heard three peeces ordnance goe ••••• castle strong hold warre portugal captaine said castle hauing promised generall captaine weddell tha • • f descryed crosse sailes ship sight castle would discharge pe • ce warning vnto accordingly wherupon man sent vp topmast head english admirall looke abroad vp presently cryed saife 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 many frigots company generall commanded gunner shoot peece ordnance giue warning flect put themselues readinesse entertainment enemie putting also bloudy colour likewise dutch admirall like speed getting men boat shore weighing anchor hand getting vnder •• le possible celerity courage resolution stood towards enemy whose drift haue taken english dutch anchor vnprepared expectation frustrate towards 8 clocke night fell calme ship came anchor commander dutch fleet named albert • becker sent • ster ship accompanied merchant master aboord royall iames informing captaine weddell commander sent see hee thought ship frigots descryed commander weddell answered could bee portugall armado bin two yeeres preparing meet english dutch come search goa vnto place hoping first conquer nation afterwards fall worke vpon ormus kishme gombroone destroy setled trade extirpe • oot v hostility dishonour dutch demanded captaine weddels resolution concerning common open enemy told resolution glory god honour nation profit worthy imployers safeguard liues ship good would fight long man liuing ship weare sword doubted three ship vnder command mind courage dutchman answered like resolution would sticke close english shirt back friendly manner tooke leaue night 1 february sunday dutch admirall weighed anchor houre daylight english presently dutch got start v though made saile could last english came vp whole fleet discharged first shot portugall admirall presently answered three one friend foe musket shot fell calme whereby ship would worke tide set portugal boord boord great aduantage v frigots rowed thē cleare one another often helpe wanted thus lay 4 5 houres pelting beating one another ordnance whilst frigots plyed v small shot fast could royall iames forced keep barge head pull ship head fro towards afternoone arose fine gale enemy wind v wherevpon admirall viceadmirall portugal bore vp roome vpon v making account • ay royall iames aboord one starboord la • boord side captaine weddell perceiuing scarce able shun called master told purpose enemy auoyd danger commanded master beare little lasking separate might haue roome go betweene vice admirall enemy seeing iames beare vp lasking likewise bore vp suddenly captaine vveddell perceiued hope weather caused mizzen mizzen top sayle set presently got wind edging close vp admirall beeing within musketshot portugall admirall put stay meanes iames got wind also hauing much adoe get w • eather comming close vnder sterne boat close • ur ship side sheared presently ••• gaue whole broad side cuery shot • king fore tacking forthwith standing thus first dayes • ight lasted till fiue night wherein royall iames lost eight men others • ad small hurt also day dutch lost chiefe commander brane valiant fellow liued dyed nobly bed honour fight terrible fierce time royall iames alone spent neere seuen hundred great shot ship english dutch proportionably doe like sunne beeing enemie sell came anchor east end kishme english northnorthwest two league thus concluded first dayes fight munday second februarie beeing candlemas day wind beeing little kishme enemy aduantage neuer offered make vse make roome towards v english dutch imployd busily • fit vp torne rigging tackling stopping dangerous shot receiued fight betwixt wind water also day afternoone meeting aboord royall iames english dutch concluded would giue enemy fight next morning royall iames leading ship admiral dutch second goe directly enemy admiral striking higher lower till iames came side side 3 f tuesday flects weighed anchor breake day hauing weather gage enemy great iames stood right admiral portugal wch headmost one comming neere weaued leeward bright arming sword like saluted v whole broad side captaine weddell cōmanded men answer til brought neerer within danger wch charge obeyed come neere admiral another ship great iames bestowed vpon whole broad side making beare vp one port starbord wch meanes one ship cut sundred thē chased 3 4 houres eagle weasope hope english dutch returne fleet company iames following still admirall vice admiral • got vpon admiral side hauing viceadmirall starbord bow insomuch dayes sight grew hot often iames thickest enemy one time round v men plyed ordnance vpon refused stand v fled v chaffe dust smoake winde sight iames got betweene one fleet singled lying • le • oresaile soretopsaile backe stayes neere man might quoit bisket cake straight master iohnson came vp sterne iames neere could hardly keepe cleare captaine weddell called willing clap portugall aboord larboord quarter whilst iames lay thundring vpon great ordnance hee promised refused vessell sew 500 shot thorow hull mast sailes yard got cleare note morning cap weddell fitted portugall vessell beene formerly taken cockernuts purposed haue fired thwart admiral l • awse appointed come dutch admiral ionas disaster rather negligence darby master came vp according appointed place chased frigots hauing ten men defence forced set fire farre fleet men betooke themselues barge left safety meanes general proiect disappointed third day night vessel burnt two houres daylight whether shee towed enemy boates vnknowne shee came burning amongst english dutch fleetes forced anchor slipping cable anchor tooke vp three dayes 4 february morning fleetes made towards enemy vnder saile made hast could get vnder iland lowracke lyeth eight nine mile ormus vnto iland frigots went ahead conducting ouer barre english dutch followed farre safety durst hauing neither helpe pilot shun danger place frigots goe head conductor enemy besides might haue beene ordnance • planted shore enemy would haue beene greatly aduantage otherwise darke night might haue chained two three frigots together turning vpon vpon ebbe thwart hawse might much haue indangered knowing enemie implacable malicious politique reason caused follow time come anchor league captaine weddell sent chiefe dutch whose resolution go backe againe gombroone dispatch merchant affaire anchor weighed iames giuing shot farewell answered like getting gombroone road night speedily fell worke repaire ruines warres fitting mast yard sailes rigging stopping breach 3 dayes accomplished leauing portugall like theefe mill fox hole minding triee yet hazard another bout fight reare admiral maine mast shot boord viceadmirals maine topmast likewise shot boord admiral mizzenmast flag flagstaffe shot boord hull much rent torne fourth ship head maine mast shot boord another ship topmast shot boord conclusion eight ship torne tattered neither good mast sailes yard helpe themselues tide side beare saile vpon thus pleased th • almighty giue victory day vnto relie vpon promise grea • god glory euer let true christian say amen 13 february friday english dutch fleet set saile daylight th • road gombroone hauing also foure iunks vessel lading vnder conduct •• charge dutch soone th • enemie perceiued let slip cable • slipped harbour iland law racke foure fiue league roade gombroone enemie making sayle could seaboord english dutch day till sunset got within sakershot good bearing gale kept company together night 13 night blew hard west • southwest one great gallions bor •• ouerboord head maine mast close vnder hownds able hoyst vp • maine sayle forced steere alongst foresaile foretopsaile spritsaile mizzen wind westsouthwest steered away south east 14 morning dutch fleet staying bearing vp vnto iunke night past starre farre english fleet could scarce descry iames laid foresaile backe stay staid portugall neuer offering alter course kept still day noone dutch come vp english agreed betweene royall iames giue first onset vpon admirall rest fleet second two clocke afternoone two fleet came weather enemy admirall receiuing first shot viceadmirall presently whole broad side admirall side comming neere could well keepe cleane • ell hand pell mell ordnance going fast small shot iames part giuing two broad side edged vp winde laying foresaile foretopstyle abacke stayes well giue leaue • second iames also suffer portugall admirall shoot head suddainly iames filling top sayle second time bore vpright enemie admirall plying whole broad side fast vpon scarce lea •••• returne shot backe whilst english portugall admiral nere could hardly cleare themselues time whilst ship plyed enemy admirall much looking heeding ship viceadmirall rest fleet left sterne admiralll plyed hard vpon iames giuing receiuing many dangerous shot iames shot betweene winde water often • oyle sayles rigging done two dayes fight third time comming side side others fleet let driue one another like thunder ayre iames comming vp admirall great ship damon first dayes fight lost maine mastcrept betwixt iames portugall admirall lying bulwa • ke weather receiue might put vpon indeed meant haue beene bestowed vpon tbe admirall still plyed vpon great hulke likewife ionas dutch continue third dayes fight till daylight shut portugal edging vp get nere arabian shore insomuch 8 night english dutch faire chasing night english dutch steered away course surat portugal steering swar place haue castle royall iames rest forced giue ouer chase reason first time whereof three chiefe captaines vnder aforesaid generall named lorenzo luis ieronimo botelia brassa coze three kild one shot ship foremast bosprect maine mast torne shot vnseruiceable mizzenmast flag wisdome stayd putting mind men let fall anchor done tide running strong brought ship strong bitter fast portugal vpon v brake whose vnexpected suddaine departure v left 50 60 men vpon poope still curse poore liues dy content lesse great temporance shepheards doth waste time many vse good creator creature abuse drinking sick vngodly health veryest cankerwormes christendome lord ambition lady best sow land euery third yeare ou • bread drinke corne growing excrement beast make v participate thn beastly nature barly growes ••• haue dungd drinke ale beere made malt many time beastly swing drunke hog moreouer hempseed hath vertue rare making bad ground good good corne beare fat earth make excell dung marle mucke dot well land beares happy seed three yeares dung need sow ground barley wheat rye still encrease aboundantly besides much knowledge know hemp growes stinking weed grow cockle darnell henbane tare nettle neere prosper spring settle antipathy seed fruitlesse vnderseruing weed feare terror strike dead make dare shew head growing weed doth kill growne keepes nature still good men v serues still releiues yeelds good whip rope rogue theeues could rehearse trade number hempseed quickly would grow poore sadlers elk haire stuffe sadles girses thousand fidle fadles ile put reader doubt rich thing worne clout paper doth conuert poore vnable mule shall next insert page meanes feed cloth family need stationer liues gaineth well doth word god buy sell know way could liue eate printed paper yeeld meat foolish knaue thinke first began ••• der three taylers one man many taylers boy know hath beene ••• made tall men much fearefull seene boy hath weapon skill •• armed taylers paperbill edgd item stiffnings facing bumbast cotton linenings laccings boy hath made man head hide bare sight bill abide boyes paper bils fright men sore ••• doubtlesse master doe many million boyes men ••• onely liue flourish pen yet though pen world renownd •• nothing except paper ground lawyer highst degree marke vnto lowest barrester clarke could doe paper beare memory speake heare justice clarkes could hardly make strong warrant theeues baudes whore like arrants ••• paper ti onely vse write right commonwealth abuse thus much paper muse hath said •• yet profit displaid • en paper mil could affoord enough write vpon praise writing stuff uoyage paperboat london quinborough haue beene left amongst boores husbandman next village language vnderstood succor hath bin small campe hath euer bin continuall cheapenes thing king duely paying souldiers end euery month hauing great merrily thing tolerable intolerable naught worse naught euery rose hath prickle euery bee sting earthly kingdome hath perfection goodnesse may bee iustly taxed imperfection prague famous ancient kingly seate scituation state compleate rich aboundance earth best treasure proud high minded beyond bound measure architecture stately attire beizonians ple • beians doe aspire apparelld stately port prophesie thus fect mabom • themselus themselues shall set gaul gaul shall spur gall castle townes tower shall fall nought horror death dread shall famous fertile france ore spread shall man depart strand borne twixt rump two great land shall make brawles cease set france friendly peace name shell strong arme calld chiefe though bearded joynd bald prophesie charily kept one himpshage scottish witch dwels caue ram one iles hebrades nine hundred yeares somewhat nigh past since merlin speke prophecie world may see sed archies person accomplished first turkes mahomet adore eares welter gere next france gaul time yore namd war hath wasted beene fire inflamd thirdly armestrong thither conuaid till peace made fourthly finde auailes borne betweene rump tailes two great kingdomes calld border midst britaine free old disorder lastly strong arme name shalbe chiefe arch bald bold agree fellow acrafty pate made cunaing anagram late word merry rascall hangd writer hand sangd quickly would inforce know moddle fellowes vnto thee haue digrest braue archybald find manifest name armstrong like strong men armes haue euer valiantly outdard harmes stout atchieuments bin acoounted regarded waited mounted whilst whose merit could win state grieued heart soe fate mayest thodrise within age vnto honour thy ancestours auxungia thy matchlesse brest may breed fresh mandrahes cause sleepe rest charme temple consuming warres thouhast done amongst rocheslers twas sharpe contention began broyles fild france fell domesticke spoyles discention farre offend wisedome scarcely could mischiefe end therfore twas ordaind thou shouldst come hang colour vp still drum cease trumpet clang fife shall squeaking bring forth frightfull peace close • ay sneaking dating visage thrust till armour committed vnto rust oh thou art halfe english halfe ••• would haue thee proud thy lot yet proud ift chance doe thou sayest thou hast done france thy worth act bee denyd thou hast ten thousand witness beside maintaine gainst eyther friend foe thou didst make peace france ti certaine thou soundst vnruly within month august iuly september thinke october thou lefst peace drunke sober dare expostulate way thy fame extenuate who • e idlenesse make knowne hath little businesse owne ranke note enuies thee thy coate let desert fall desert due thine honour thine owne fresh new war could end war twas plainely aeols breath doth fill ttetic harbots whale sprat sunne doth quicken dying plant thy illustrious shine doth glad heart earth supplyes needfull want doth thy bounty guerdon good desarts like aytie aeols pleasant gale thou filst ioy sailes rich pore sea doth harbour sprat whale thou high low yeelds harbour flore thus sea ayre earth titan fiery face elementall seruants thy grace life since earth thou wondrous wandring gest arithmetician neuer number seuerall lodging thouhast tane man fish fowle tame bruitish beast since thee greatest least squard well compard vnto span oh fleeting life take •• counsell hold long possession thy royall breast dwell euer king queene prince gracious princesse princely spouse thou hast lasting house fate death time cannot conuince change thy lodging thou art driuen thy selfe exalted heauen death thee whose auaritious greedy mood doth play sweepe stake liuing thing like horsleech quaffes seuerall blood subiects abiects emperours king high low must feele thy sting lord lowne caitiffe keasar beggers death much contentment brings thee fall iulius caesar since good bad one larkes thee better kite take bad let good alone feed base wretch leaue worthy wight thee wicked euermore stay thee fame take good away eternity thou beyond thing dost go farre cosmographer could ere suruay whose glory brighter great phebus carre doth shine night doth nere eclipse day thee consecrate prince act thee alone let being let measure famous tract begin neuer end like thee thy seruant time giues life death death surrender liues fame oh inspire celestiall breath saint martyr applaud thy name thus vnto thee thine owne proper right iconsecrate matchles worthy wight iohn taylor finis taylor farevvell tower bottle argvment three hundred twenty yeares since thereabout thinke raigne king richard second guift giuen tower lieutenant thereof time euer beeing guift two blacke leather bottle bombard wine euery ship brought wine riuer thames hath continued
